posts.post_content:
This is the most melvin planeswalker to date
  
his fight ability works with his 2/2 wolf to flip him
  
his plus 1 sets up his minus one perfectly
  
his minus one fills your graveyard for his minus 3
  
his plus one lets the entire boost from his minus 3 trample over with the deathtouch.

Posted By: Pinsir52 (9/24/2011 7:41:49 AM)

posts.post_content:
First hybrid planewalker frame! First planeshifted hybrid frame as well!  
  
The type and title background is dark grey - not because he's black - but because hybrid cards have light gray background and thus planeshifted hybrid frames should use a dark gray background.  
  
Cool, if that's the sort of thing you're into.
posts.html:
First hybrid planewalker frame! First planeshifted hybrid frame as well!

posts.post_content:
Why on earth would they do this? I love Garruk, and I really really enjoy the flavor of this card, but why make him Black when Wolf/Werewolf are R/G this block? I would have no issue at all if they had made all the wolves/werewolves B/G, but that's not the case.
  
   
Plus, I feel like his -1 ability makes him an auto $30+ card.

Posted By: Dr.Pingas (10/3/2011 9:11:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5/5  
  
+1 :: WOLF TOKEN WITH DEATH TOUCH FOR THE WIN! :D Death touch kills anything that fights it, no questions ask. If only wolves had more support.  
  
-1 :: Wolf token decks now rely a lot on the graveyard, sacrificing a creature activates Morbid effects (Common for Green cards and other cards like that.) as well as feeds the effect for Gravecaller effects (Group name for "For every creature in your Graveyard" effects). Although, he would have 2 Loyalty counters to begin with, so I do not think the -1 effect would be wise right off the bat.  
  
-3 :: At the most your going to have to wait for this is 1 turn because of his other forms "when it has 2 or less loyalty counters" effect. But pretty much game winning if you use the right way.
posts.html:
5/5

+1 :: WOLF TOKEN WITH DEATH TOUCH FOR THE WIN! :D Death touch kills anything that fights it, no questions ask. If only wolves had more support.

-1 :: Wolf token decks now rely a lot on the graveyard, sacrificing a creature activates Morbid effects (Common for Green cards and other cards like that.) as well as feeds the effect for Gravecaller effects (Group name for "For every creature in your Graveyard" effects). posts.post_content: I like the front side. Wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves. I don't like how fragile Garruk is once he's flipped. He's just so vulnerable to [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock) and [Incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incinerate) and what have you. Granted, he can start throwing out the wolves and gaining loyalty from it, but I really don't like that downtime where's he's so easy to kill.

posts.post_content: New Garruk is very powerful. He removes one of their small creatures and transforms or spits out 2/2 wolves for free every turn. When he is transformed he becomes a nightmare for your opponent, creating dangerous deathtouching wolves that can attack with near impunity or block and kill anything that attacks you. He tutors for whatever creature you need, and his final ability can end the game.

He tutors for whatever creature you need, and his final ability can end the game.

posts.post_content:
This guy needs a Beauty and the Beast alter. This card. This...card....Vorthos has a field day every time he sees it. Survival of the Fittest, on the Cursed Beast Man, in Parallel Lives Worlld? Its...its...GAAHHH!! drawn by a Frenchie, too.
  
too much. overload.
  
In order to make room for more Walkers, I hope Garruk dies on Innistrad. I think his story is a GREAT one, I love the character, but the best thing you can really do with your best characters is to grant them Epic Death Scenes and a Curtain Bow to thunderous applause. In cases like Jace TMS, however, rather than granting him the honor of an on-stage death scene, you should instead de-power him or just stop writing about him. Looks like Wizards went with de-powering so they can tell more Jace stories. That's fine. I don't think they can make Garruk's story any better though- it's so fantastic, I feel like it's really setting up a climactic finish with Liliana, probably right before Dark Ascension. (Which mark my words, will be... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

too much. overload.

Posted By: DarthParallax (9/26/2011 1:17:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really [Goblin Fireslinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Fireslinger) is probably the safest way to transform him, unless you could attack him with your own creatures (you can't do that, right?). Then, activate his +1 that turn to put a 1/1 wolf with deathtouch, then you can activate his ultimate next turn. It reaches its ultimate really quick, IMO, but you'd need to put a lot creatures in your grave AND battlefield to make it effective.  
Also, there is the issue that it sucks against Red, because a single [Incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incinerate) kills him, as I've mentioned in my incredibly hateful comment on [Garruk Relentless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Relentless).
